body:
### Problem

I find it very difficult to follow the building instructions.. 

I have CLion and Visual Studio 2022 installed and the options mentioned in the linked document do not correspond to what I see.

[BUILD.md](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/BUILD.md)

### Expected behavior

It would be very helpful to develop one or more powershell scripts that will clone all necessary repositories and execute the building process automatically and review the provided instructions for Visual Studio and CLion.

comment_data.body:
Dependencies already are automatically downloaded by cmake, why would we add a powershell script?

> execute the building process automatically

That should already work with any build tool or IDE that supports CMake.

> do not correspond to what I see

So... what do you see instead?

The clion instructions are:

> Windows / CLion
> 1. Install [CLion](https://www.jetbrains.com/clion/).
> 1. Open the Neovim project in CLion.
> 1. Select Build â†’ Build All in 'Release'.

Thank you so much for responding.

I will try to describe everything step by step.

If I try to build in WSL 2 with Arch, then the build process works automatically like you said.

```git clone```
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93aac908-4818-4e4e-bc47-040832d15cda)

Open CLion and choose CMake Project

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e81fce63-7a48-4f82-a7ec-f0ecc5bdd70e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8a1c5a6c-57b0-4347-a7a4-65720dc60102)

Please notice, that the loading was performed automatically by CLion.

The option  
`Select Build â†’ Build All in 'Release'.`
is not available / possible

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/81f76e53-cb96-46c9-9e64-624585a777af)

> ```
> C:/Users/panag/AppData/Local/Programs/CLion/bin/mingw/bin/mingw32-make.exe -C src
> mingw32-make[1]: Entering directory 'C:/my/development/cpp/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/build/src/luajit/src'
> VERSION   luajit.h
> /usr/bin/sh: -c: line 1: syntax error near unexpected token `('
> ```

It looks like the luajit dependency expects a POSIX shell to build itself.

Almost the inverse of https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/31027 , where powershell is used in a unix shell.
Uh, should we just remove windows support from the makefile by reverting the commit?

Before making any final decision please give some time. 
I will try to find a solution on my side and post here.

> Uh, should we just remove windows support from the makefile by reverting the commit?

CLion shouldn't be using our top-level Makefile. From glancing at the above logs, my guess is that luajit's build (Makefile?) is where the (first) problem is.

Today I am trying the command line options as described in [Windows / MSYS2 / MinGW](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/BUILD.md#windows--msys2--mingw)

c:\my\development\cpp\neovim>set PATH=c:\msys64\ucrt64\bin;c:\msys64\usr\bin;%PATH%
```

title: build from source on Windows using CLion
